mainText: Safari Technology Preview Release 70 is now available for download for macOS Mojave and macOS High Sierra. This release covers web animations, intersection observer, css, WebRTC, web inspector and many more.

Google design and perf advocate, Paul Lewis has announced they need developer feedback on Frame timing API. This API is in draft state and basically allows us to measure the frame per second of JavaScript, CSS animations. Tracking the smoothness of the application is another usage. For more info please visit wicg.github.io/frame-timing/

Microsoft announced TypeScript 3.2 RC, the release candidate of our next version of TypeScript. Some of the upcoming features include strictBindCallApply, Object spread on generic types, Object rest on generic types, and more great features. You can check Microsoft roadmap for TypeScript for more information.

VS Code had its October release a week ago and it contains yet another set of great features. Dirty file indicator, enhanced zen mode, and directory inheritance in the terminal are the new features added to it in this release.

Introducing Slate, an open source and completely customisable framework for building rich text editors. Slate lets you build rich, intuitive editors like those in Medium, Dropbox Paper or Google Docs—which are becoming table stakes for applications on the web—without your codebase getting mired in complexity.
